channel.title: Reading on Leonardo Benicio
channel.description: Recent content in Reading on Leonardo Benicio

item.title: A Mathematical Theory of Communication
item.description: Foundational paper that created information theory, introducing entropy and channel capacity.

item.title: Algorithm Design
item.description: A practical approach to algorithm design with emphasis on design paradigms and proofs of correctness.

item.title: Algorithms
item.description: An accessible algorithms textbook with strong intuition and mathematical clarity.

item.title: Algorithms (4th ed.)
item.description: A comprehensive introduction to algorithms with Java implementations and extensive online resources.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (4th ed.)
item.description: Definitive textbook on AI covering search, knowledge, planning, learning, and applications.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (4th ed.)
item.description: Definitive AI textbook covering search, knowledge, planning, learning, and applications.

item.title: Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Inference (2nd ed.)
item.description: A rigorous treatment of causal inference and graphical models.

item.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
item.description: Guidelines and principles for writing readable, maintainable, and testable code.

item.title: Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools (2nd ed.)
item.description: The classic “Dragon Book” covering the theory and practice of compiler construction.

item.title: Computer Architecture: A Quantitative Approach (6th ed.)
item.description: Definitive textbook on modern computer architecture and performance analysis.

item.title: Computer Architecture: A Quantitative Approach (6th ed.)
item.description: An in-depth treatment of modern processor and system design with quantitative evaluation.

item.title: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach (7th ed.)
item.description: A top-down exploration of computer networking from applications to physical layer.

item.title: Computer Networks (5th ed.)
item.description: Classic text covering network layers, protocols, and architectures.

item.title: Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective (3rd ed.)
item.description: Bridges programming and computer architecture with a focus on performance and systems.

item.title: Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective (3rd ed.)
item.description: Bridges the gap between programming and computer architecture with a focus on performance and systems.

item.title: Database System Concepts (7th ed.)
item.description: Foundational text on database design, SQL, normalization, transactions, and architectures.

item.title: Database System Concepts (7th ed.)
item.description: Foundational text on database design, SQL, transactions, and architectures.

item.title: Deep Learning
item.description: Comprehensive textbook on deep learning theory and practice.

item.title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
item.description: Seminal catalog of software design patterns for building flexible, reusable object-oriented systems.

item.title: Distributed Systems: Principles and Paradigms (2nd ed.)
item.description: Foundational coverage of distributed system models, communication, consistency, and coordination.

item.title: Introduction to Algorithms (3rd ed.)
item.description: A comprehensive and rigorous textbook covering algorithms and data structures, widely used in CS curricula.

item.title: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation (3rd ed.)
item.description: Classic text on automata, formal languages, Turing machines, and computational complexity.

item.title: Introduction to Parallel Computing (2nd ed.)
item.description: A comprehensive textbook on models, algorithms, and performance analysis for parallel computing.

item.title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation (3rd ed.)
item.description: Accessible introduction to automata theory, computability, and complexity.

item.title: Mining of Massive Datasets (3rd ed.)
item.description: Core techniques for large-scale data mining and analysis.

item.title: Modern Operating Systems (4th ed.)
item.description:
A comprehensive OS textbook covering processes, memory management, file systems, and security

A comprehensive OS textbook covering processes, memory management, file systems, and security.

item.title: On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem
item.description: Seminal paper introducing the concept of Turing machines and computability.

item.title: OpenMP Application Programming Interface, Version 5.2
item.description: Official OpenMP specification with the latest directives, memory model, and examples.

item.title: Operating System Concepts (9th ed.)
item.description: Foundations of operating systems including processes, threads, scheduling, memory, and file systems.

item.title: Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces
item.description: A free, modular OS textbook with hands-on projects and clear explanations.

item.title: Parallel Programming in C with MPI and OpenMP
item.description: Introductory yet practical coverage of parallel programming in C using both MPI and OpenMP.

item.title: Patterns for Parallel Programming
item.description: Pattern-based approach to structuring parallel programs across shared and distributed memory.

item.title: Principles of Database and Knowledge-Base Systems
item.description: Foundational theory for databases and knowledge-base systems.

item.title: Principles of Program Analysis
item.description: Formal foundations of program analysis including data-flow and abstract interpretation.

item.title: Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems
item.description: A seminal work on Bayesian networks and probabilistic reasoning.

item.title: Security Engineering (3rd ed.)
item.description: An encyclopedic treatment of security engineering principles, attacks, and defenses.

item.title: Software Engineering (10th ed.)
item.description: A broad overview of software engineering principles, processes, and management.

item.title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
item.description: Classic text teaching fundamental concepts of programming and abstraction using Scheme.

item.title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
item.description: A classic text that teaches fundamental programming concepts and abstraction using Scheme.

item.title: Structured Computer Organization (6th ed.)
item.description: A foundational text on computer organization bridging hardware and software.

item.title: The Art of Computer Programming, Vols. 1–4A
item.description: Foundational multi-volume work on algorithms, data structures, and analysis of algorithms.

item.title: The Pragmatic Programmer (20th Anniversary ed.)
item.description: Timeless advice on becoming an effective, pragmatic software developer.

item.title: Using MPI: Portable Programming with the Message Passing Interface (3rd ed.)
item.description: Hands-on guide to MPI for building distributed-memory parallel programs, complementing OpenMP.

item.title: Using OpenMP: Portable Shared Memory Parallel Programming
item.description: Practical OpenMP techniques, performance tips, and patterns for shared-memory parallel programming.
